title: Motivations
contents:
Why R?
I attended a short modular course on R, and was introduced to more effective and efficient ways of structuring data for customised plots that look way better than on Excel and SPSS. At the end of the course, I really wanted to retain what I have learnt, and build on what I have learnt, so that I can be better at R.
Aristotle — ‘The more you know, the more you know you don’t know.’
and that makes me want to learn even more.

title: My first post: Learning goals for 2021
description: pRactice corner for coding in R
contents:
Hi, this is my practice corner for coding in R. I would want to:
learn tidyverse
practice on data visualization, exploration.
learn tidymodels/machine learning
learn Design of Experiment
learn Chemometrics
learn how to analyse sensory data
be able to communicate insights from data analysis using the Rmarkdown/distill packages
